column1:
,TRUE,5,5,5,5,5 TroublesBrewing","2017-01-06T23:47:41.553Z","Minifigure set with a cool Catcycle and a small vignette ","

With a new Batman series of sets you better believe there will be a motorcycle and double points if its for Catwoman.

column2: a minifigure 3 pack with an added vehicle and small vignette play set. So lets dive right in...

column1: The LEGO Company has gone all out on the detail in The Batman Movie minifigures and this set is is a perfect example. Both Catwoman
column2: and Batgirl have awesome detail in their arm and leg&nbsp
column3: printing. The inclusion of side buckles on Batgirls boots is a nice touch and a node to the current comic book version. Two color molding looks great for Batgirls legs, but really shines with both Robins legs and arms. Oh, and lets not forget about the utility belts. Such a great addition to the minifigures.

column1: The Catcycle! For a small build it is very well built and has
column2: a nice Bat-pod feel to it. The printed tiles have great detail and put the finishing touches on this&nbsp
column3: great little motorcycle. The build technics are impressive for&nbsp
column4: such a small set. The construction takes advantage of the wide wheels so the cycle stays up right.

column1: Okay, this is the weakest part of the set, but not as bad as other sets. No printed parts, but a few stickers. I'
column2: m okay with the sticker on the door and the store sign, but the 2x2 tile should have been printed. The jewelry store is naturally&nbsp
column4: good choice for a Catwoman set and for the minimal amount of pieces involved looks pretty good. It has&nbsp
column8: display value. However at this size you really can&#39
column9: t complain.

column1: As I stated already, this is a minifigure
column3: you will not be disappointed in them. Taking into account that minifigures run $3.99 USD a piece, that leaves the remaining piece count just under 6 cents a piece. That&#39

column8: >Set #70902 Catwoman&rsquo
column9: s Catcycle Chase:
column14: > This is the third time a LEGO Batman set has featured Catwoman and a motorcycle. LEGO Batman, LEGO DC Super Heroes and now The LEGO Batman Movie have given us an interpretation of this set. This is the first one not to feature Batman though, Catwoman is being chased by Robin and Batgirl now.

column8: >This review will cover all of the basics and then conclude with whether or not it&rsquo
column9: s a set worth picking up.

column8: >Box: Once again we come to find tiny box sizes, these compact boxes are a bit of a surprise actually. They seem to be designed to take up much less shelf space to accommodate more boxes in the distribution cases and on the shelf at a given time. I like this notion and would hope to see it adopted more often, the much larger boxes with far too much space truly are a waste.
>The only downside is the lack of space for the manual, some could find creased or damaged manuals if not careful during the packing process.
>Instructions: The manual is smaller than the Mr. Freeze set, a lot thinner, but still features all of the amenities you&rsquo
column9: ve come to expect. Modular building seems to be a huge thing with The LEGO Batman Movie, all of the sets feature numbered bags to work with and so the build instructions are cut in half for each model and make following along easy and relatively trouble free.

column8: >This set is woefully lacking in parts, especially for its price. 139 pieces and nothing much to offer, there are of course some nice printed elements featuring detailing for Catwoman&rsquo
column9: s motorcycle. Still a tad dismal for people hoping for decent parts packs.

column8: >Batgirl: A new interpretation of the Character in LEGO form, this Minifigure is a great value for this set. This is the cheapest to get her outside of the Polybag being given away with the film in June and the detailing on her is sublime.
>You&rsquo
column9: ve got dual-molded legs with side-printing for her boots, a dual-sided torso with arm printing for wrist guards and extra shoulder padding. And a brand new cowl piece with a ponytail additional piece to stick out the back. Her cape is the older material, not softer for easy flipping action. She has two expressions, angry and happy and includes the new utility belt piece and yellow batarangs. She&rsquo

column8: >Catwoman: Equally decked out in awesome detailing, Catwoman shines. No dual molding on her, but she has a dual-sided torso in purple with excellent detail work for her costume, some leg printing to further enhance the detailing, a new cowl piece with built-in goggles, two expressions (again happy and angry), a purple utility belt and a small whip accessory.
>Everything about these Minifigures is great, I could recommend them over and over again just because of how intricate they&rsquo
column9: ve been made.

column8: >Robin: Quirky Robin is loaded with fun detailing too, though not as much as the ladies. He has dual-molded legs for his traditional 60&rsquo
column9: s era look, a double-sided torso fun new hair piece with goggles and two separate expressions, again happy, but this time confused or concerned on the other side. His cape is the older style, not the soft material and like Batgirl is quite shiny looking. He has no accessories however. Dual-molding on the arms as well.

column8: >Bag 1: Catwoman and her motorcycle are built using this bag. Technic parts are used mostly in building this model and it doesn&rsquo
column9: t take too long to construct it. Honestly it is a bit of a weak build, but world&rsquo
column10: s better than the Harley Quinn set from last year. This model is at least of a decent enough scale if a bit on the larger side as far as bike models go.

column8: >Bag 2: This build is a small fa&ccedil
column9: ade, which is in keeping with how things look in LEGO movies. This is a fun build, however it does use stickers for some detailing and there&rsquo
column10: s really very little to construct, it&rsquo
column11: s more like a 15.99$ set with the number of pieces used. Batgirl and Robin are also inside this bag.

column8: >Jewelry Store: This little model is a fa&ccedil
column9: ade, there&rsquo
column10: s very little involved in the interior, a pair of jewels is on display and the rest is open space. This might seem disappointing and honestly I was initially disheartened by the models in this series, until I realized that, much like The LEGO Movie these aren&rsquo
column11: t meant to represent actual buildings, but actual models that are being interacted with by physical LEGO figures.

column8: >In other words these are supposed to be toys playing with toys much like Toy Story. Granted the models are still a bit lacking for the price, however the charm of the little models and the massive vehicles adds more to the fun. Some stickers are used for detailing and a streetlamp is built on the side of the storefront. It&rsquo
column9: s a cute little model and actually works well.

column8: >Catwoman&rsquo
column9: s Catcycle: This is a huge model, it is not Minifigure scale, it&rsquo
column10: s a technic inspired build with bricks and pins used for detailing. The purple colouring is pretty impressive making the model pop when looked at. The printed elements add to the detail and charm of the bike, it reminds me of a smaller interpretation of Wildstyle&rsquo
column11: s bike from The LEGO Movie, without all of the odd detail work from it being rebuilt out of pieces of buildings and such. I honestly believe this is the best Catcycle attempt LEGO has given us, it involves much more building compared to simply using a bike chassis and some detail elements and it is worlds better than the Harley Bike in the DC Super Heroes Theme.

column8: >Not too big to be obtuse, and yet not the same as other LEGO Motorcycles.
>Honestly the biggest draw for me is the Minifigures in this set, but the models have a certain charm to them and are definitely nice. I just do not like the price of the set, when you&rsquo
column9: re making such tiny looking models for the finished product 25$ seems like a lot, comparing this to other Themes there are often a lot better models and piece counts for your dollar in value, the Great Vehicles in LEGO City alone offer up a much more impressive build.

column8: >My recommendation is to try and get these on sale. They&rsquo
column9: re great sets, don&rsquo
column10: t get me wrong, just a tad disappointing in the value front. This one isn&rsquo
column11: t nearly as bad as the Mr. Freeze set though, at least the bulk of the build is a decent structure comparatively.

,TRUE,4,5,4,4,4 8BrickMario","2017-02-06T02:33:47.763Z","You can't teach an old cat new tricks...","

Look familiar? Almost like we'
column2: ve seen Catwoman getting away on a bike after a jewelry robbery before? What made me get this, and is it worth it?

column1: Purple is not nearly such a hot commodity anymore these days, but there are some nice pieces in it.
Robin- Such a goofy and fun take on the character. His hair/goggles piece has a lot of character, especially due to his nervous squint in this set,
column2: and I like how classic his uniform is. His cape is nice, and has a metallic finish on one side.

column1: Batgirl- Also very classic, but in a different way. This version is essentially an update of the original Batgirl from the 60'
column2: s show, which is convenient for those disappointed by her absence in said Batcave. Her cowl is a new piece and it has an interesting peg system for her ponytail to attach to. I feel like the ponytail is a bit too small and flat, as it has to be angled out to be seen. Underneath, we see her face, which has slightly skewed proportions to fit through the cowl&#39
column4: eyeholes. I wonder why they decided that was necessary, instead of just molding the mask better.&nbsp

column1: Her uniform is standard Batfamily fare, in the classic purple and yellow, and she has the new utility belt as well as a metallic cape, but in the Batman cut.

Catwoman- Also an updated return to the roots, as she too has gone back to her original purple. The design is very hard to parse from a distance (which may be the point), but it looks good up close. She has a new Cat-cowl, and her green goggles can be seen underneath. Both of her faces feature these goggles, and her expressions are angry and confident. Her skin seems a bit darker, but I'
column4: s printed on darker plastic or because her race has been changed like the Gordons.&nbsp
column7: very hard to see her mouth when she wears the mask, although I suspect that&#39
column8: s also intentional. She also has the utility belt, but in purple, and her typical whip. This version of her in full costume is exclusive to this set.

column1: First up is a tiny jewelry shop that begs to be robbed with its cat-diamond logo. It'
column3: basically just a display for the jewels, but I appreciate the awning and the cat-up-a-tree poster on the side. A light pole is attached, and it can be adjusted for various degrees of damage.
motorcycle is the main build, and it&#39
column4: s properly built up from scratch this time. I like the machinery details, and how rugged&nbsp
column5: and thrown-together it feels. The wheels are clever, too, as they&#39
column6: re unevenly mounted, but rest level when the vehicle is on the ground.

column1: This is essentially a glorified minifigure pack, but it'
column2: s a good one. I feel like the repetitive-Catwoman-set format is part of the movie&#39
column5: new twist on an old classic&quot
column6: joke here, and the two models are decent little things.

column1:
,TRUE,3,5,4,5,5 Khscarymovie","2017-08-04T21:48:43.867Z","A Great Set From A Great Theme","

The Lego Batman Movie had an incredible first wave, and I believe this is one of the finest
The minifigures here are are some of the most colourful I have ever seen. First up we have Robin, this version of Robin might be the best ever, his hair piece connects to his glasses so you can'
column2: t use the hair for something else unless you use the glasses. Next we have Batgirl, this version is similar to the 1960s tv show version, which is fitting as she was missing from the 1960s Batcave last&nbsp
column3: year. Last we have Catwomen, who is the perfect enemy for Batgirl as they both covered in purple. This is by far the best version of Catwomen we have had so far. This version of Catwomen is exclusive to this set, but you can get Robin and Batgirl in more expensive sets.&nbsp

column2: motorcycle, this is the third time we have gotten a Catwomen motorcycle , and it is by far the best. Insted of using a simple cycle piece it is brickbuilt and it looks great. I love the little bits of purple in the bike. The other build is a store that contains 2 diamonds. I always love small builds like this, it reminds me of something I would build when I was younger. There is a street light that is the only play feature in the entire set, this might be disappointing&nbsp
column3: to some. The help poster on the side of he shop is a nice touch.

column1: Overall I think this is a very nice set and one of my favorites from the amazing Lego Batman Movie theme. He minifigures are incredible and the builds are great, there are not many play functions which may disappoint some of the younger Lego fans. The price is also really good.

s also a side simple build for a jewelry store that you can build without looking into the instructions, however I used those parts for my personal build.

column1: Overall opinion, it is a nice set to collect great figures with a decent build and playability.

,TRUE,5,5,4,4,5 PerryThePlatypus","2020-05-06T20:57:34.56Z","Sheâ€™s at it again with the diamond stealing huh?","

So, I bought this set recently at a store where it sat on the shelves for 3 years now, it sure did take me a while to buy it. I&rsquo
column2: m REALLY glad I picked up this set, I seriously don&rsquo
column3: t know why it took me so long to get it as one of the few Lego Batman Movie sets I saw on store shelves and never bought, luckily for me, no one bought it and I was able to enjoy this set for myself.

column2: obviously the best part of the main bike build is that IT&rsquo
column3: S NOT A TYPICAL 20 DOLLAR LICENSED OVERSIZED BIKE SET! It&rsquo
column4: s unbelievable that for once, Lego made a realistically sized brick built&nbsp
column5: bike that was at a good scale compared to a minifigure. Not only was the sizing really good, but I was impressed with how the whole bike is built and with good detail put into it. There were quite a few Technic pieces going into the frame of the bike. The seating area can fit Catwoman just fine, next to it are 2 exhaust pipes on either side that could be moved up or down as they&rsquo
column7: s also a printed 2 by 2 slope piece with purple flames and a speedometer on it, which looks very awesome. A handle is also included for Catwoman to hold while driving it, in front of where the handle is attached is where a headlight could be found. Overall, a really awesome bike, I have no problems with it whatsoever.

column3: I thought the side build of the set was gonna be plain and boring, but it definitely surprised me on how much I enjoyed it. There was a 12 by 6 grey plate piece as the base. Next to the diamond store is a trash can in green, a nice help poster with a cat on it as a sticker on the wall to the side of the shop and a lamppost (it&rsquo
column4: s shown as the only play feature of the set to knock down the lamppost, it&rsquo
column5: s not the most exciting thing, but it works for what it is). The door has a nice sticker on it that says closed and next to it is a clear panel piece to display the diamonds. Not much is going on in the interior, just a clear and translucent red diamond to be found. At the top, the store sign is attached by a clip and the sign itself uses a 2 by 4 tile with a sticker that has a gem that looks like a cat on it which looks nice. Next to the sign is a little awning build with dark green and white 1 by 1 cheese slopes, and it makes the store look a little more complete than it actually is, which I like. Overall,&nbsp
column7: s not an amazing or perfect side build that&nbsp
column8: definitely could&#39

column2: Wow, what an amazing figure, this is by far the best version of Catwoman Lego Made. The legs and torso have a lot of silver shine to it (also on the back of the torso&nbsp
column3: and the beautiful arm printing)which looks amazing. She also comes with a utility belt in purple, which looks very cool. For her facial expressions, she has a confident smile and an angry expression as the alternate face, both very nice expressions. Her mask was a new piece, it has ears on top of it and an impression of goggles going around the mask. She comes with a whip as her accessory, overall a very impressive figure that&rsquo
column4: s definitely a big draw to get this set, it sucks that she&rsquo

column3: s not difficult to get in the line, she&rsquo

A lot effort was put into this figure which I really appreciate, I like the side leg printing for the boots of the dual-molded legs and arm printing for the continuation of the suit design. She has the common yellow utility belt piece, her front and back torso printing was also very good. The cape is a different material to the soft one, it has a shine to it that looks awesome. Her facial expressions have a happy and angry expression and the mask was a well made piece that could attach Batgirl&rsquo
column6: s hair using a peg connection. She also comes with 2 yellow batarangs as her accessories, overall nothing exclusive but still a great figure.

column2: He pretty much has the same deal as the Batgirl minifig from this set, nothing hard to get or exclusive but still nice to get in a cheaper set. he has dual molded legs that have red boots and his torso printing has the Robin logo and printed yellow utility belt which is carried on to the back. The material of his cape was also the same as Batgirl&rsquo
column3: s with the same shine to it. He&rsquo

column5: s nice to get in a cheaper set.

column1: The value of the set is pretty decent, you get 3 awesome minifigs and 2 great builds, and what&rsquo

column1: This a really great set that gives you an amazing twist to the awful oversized 20 dollar bike sets with a genuinely good bike. The 3 figures you get here are phenomenal (especially Catwoman), and the diamond store was a cute little side build. I highly recommend getting this set if you find it for a good price online, I&rsquo
column4: set, all things included here were fun and awesome.
